body: Ah.  Now I understand.  If you are planning to use the comfort shade benefit to evaluate building shade, you should usually send the zone Operative temperatures through the ZoneData input of the Zone Shade component.  This way, you can evaluate the shades in terms of indoor comfort (although this is probably only meaningful when your building is not conditioned). [](http://api.ning.com:80/files/E-eiwesnIS0tUApHDtmmOPrDn8AUFAK8SaVhclIaV8-osmX6i8VfZLkSh4YYlu7vZlvUcjtclNOlWYXzH5Cco0ayhFOGsJkH/IndoorComfShadeBenefit.PNG) If you want to evaluate your building shade in terms of outdoor comfort (which seems a bit weird but nonetheless possible), all that you have to do is duplicate the outdoor air temperature data to match the number of windows like so: [](http://api.ning.com:80/files/E-eiwesnIS0hMrmlBf1YChRkIcI6BuQdb6Tjam68pe30Wk0CFii99hUQDDDMJhf8nG2l37njEpsXSHWrCMKrCBb3SQ2BvWO0/OutdoorComfShadeBenefit.PNG) The attached file shows how to do all 3 of these cases (Energy, Indoor Comfort, Outdoor Comfort) -Chris
